question: Is PPROM a condition that occurs in males or females?
ideal_answer: Preterm premature rupture of fetal membranes (PPROM) occurs in pregnant females.

Preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM) is a condition leading to an increased risk of maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality in pregnant women.
UNLABELLED: Preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM) occurs in 3% of pregnancies and is responsible for one third of all pre
Preterm premature rupture of the membranes (PPROM) occurs in approximately 3% of all pregnancies, and accounts for one third of all preterm births.
